title: Dow Jones Top Company Headlines at 11 PM ET: Intel's CEO, Under Attack From Trump, Is Already at Odds With His Board
content:
Intel's CEO, Under Attack From Trump, Is Already at Odds With His Board

Lip-Bu Tan and the chip maker's directors have been clashing over how to revive the tech giant.

Apple Got the Jump on Tariffs, Deciding Years Ago to Make iPhones in India

Chief executive Tim Cook sought new factory locales outside China, a prescient move that along with a new $100 billion U.S. investment will shield the company-for now.

The new group is spearheading work on the latest version of Llama, the large language model that is Meta's answer to ChatGPT.

Australian financial-technology provider Iress said it is in talks with Blackstone, having already considered an earlier proposal by the U.S. private-equity giant

The online travel agency raised its guidance for the full year after its second-quarter results beat expectations.

The social media company reported net income of $38.8 million, or 6 cents a share.

The videogame developer now expects a narrower per-share loss of $2.40 to $2.05 for fiscal 2026.

The Foster City, Calif.-based biopharmaceutical company said the growth was driven by Biktarvy, Descovy, Trodelvy and Livdelzi.

OpenAI Unveils GPT-5, Its Latest and Most Powerful Model, After Two-Year Wait

CEO Sam Altman said using the chatbot will be like talking with a doctorate-level expert in any topic.

The company behind payment systems Cash App and Square sees full-year gross profit, a key indicator for Block, increasing 14.4%, up from previous guidance of 12% growth.

The safety and security company posted higher profit and revenue in the second quarter, saying it is continuing to work with its global supply base to mitigate exposure to tariff risks.

Disney Settles Suit With Actress Dismissed From 'The Mandalorian'

With financial backing from Elon Musk's X, Gina Carano alleged she was fired from the Star Wars series over social media posts.

Summer Concert Season Off to a Booming Start, Live Nation Says

Strong attendance and fan spending helped the world's largest concert promoter beat expectations for its second-quarter revenue, but its earnings per share fell short.

The grocery-delivery company, also known as Maplebear, posted net income of $116 million, or 41 cents a share.

The Las Vegas operator of casinos and resorts reported that sales rose slightly, with casino revenue offsetting declines across the rest of the company's segments.

Companies used to be wary of replacing their customer service with AI. Now, they are starting to see it as a necessity, said CEO Keyvan Mohajer.

The St. Louis-based maker of consumer packaged goods reported higher-than-expected profit and revenue in the third quarter.

The Texas-based space company sold more than 19 million shares in its initial public offering, raising $868 million.
summary: Intel's CEO, Lip-Bu Tan, and the chip maker's directors are reportedly at odds over how to revive the tech giant. Apple's CEO Tim Cook has sought new factory locales outside China, a move that along with a new $100 billion investment, could help the company. Iress is in talks with Blackstone, having previously considered an earlier proposal by the U.S. private-equity giant. The online travel agency, which reported a second-quarter results beating expectations, now expects a narrower per-share loss of $2.40 to $2.,05 for fiscal 2026. The company behind payment systems Cash App and Square sees full-year gross profit increasing 14.4%, up from previous guidance of 12%. OpenAI has unveiled its latest and most powerful model, GPT-5, after two-year delay. Disney settles suit with actress Gina Carano over social media posts.
shortSummary: Intel's CEO, under attack from President Trump, is in conflict with his board, while shares rose and shares rose in New York and London.
argos_summary: Intel's CEO is facing challenges from both former President Trump and internal board disagreements regarding strategies to revitalize the company. Meanwhile, Apple has successfully shifted iPhone production to India, a move that has positioned it favorably against tariffs. Other companies, including OpenAI, have made significant advancements, with OpenAI unveiling its latest model, GPT-5, which promises enhanced conversational capabilities.
